metadata.Title: CVE-2014-2892 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the get_answer function in mmsh.c in libmms before 0.6.4 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a long line in an MMS over HTTP (MMSH) server response.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2892` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmms0 - 0.6.2-3ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libmms package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.6.2-3ubuntu2.1').
